com.projectBackEnd.dao

Class JobDAO

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.projectBackEnd.dao.JobDAO

  • @ApplicationScoped
public class JobDAO
extends java.lang.Object
    JobDAO class handles the persistence of Job objects to the mongo database. This class uses Hibernate OGM(Object Grid Mapping) to handle the mappings of objects between BSON(the mongodb syntax) and java syntax.
    Author:
    Gary Connelly

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      JobDAO()

      All Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      void create(Job job)
      Allows for the creation of a new Job object in the mongo database.

      Allows for the deletion of Job objects in the mongo database.
      Job findById(java.lang.String id)
      Gets a handle on the Job object in the database that has a particular id.
      java.util.List getAll()
      Gets a handle on all of the Job objects that exist in the database, maps them to the Job class, and returns them in a list.

    • Constructor Detail

      • JobDAO

        public JobDAO()

    • Method Detail

      • getAll

        public java.util.List getAll()
        Gets a handle on all of the Job objects that exist in the database, maps them to the Job class, and returns them in a list.
        Returns:
        List, the list of all Jobs that exist in the database.

      • findById

        public Job findById(java.lang.String id)
        Gets a handle on the Job object in the database that has a particular id. If such a Job exists, it is mapped to the Job class and returned as a Job object.
        Parameters:
        id, - the id of the Job to be returned.
        Returns:
        Job, the Job object, if one exists in the database with the same id as the given parameter.

      • update

        public void update(Job job)
        Allows an existing Job object in the database to be modified. Uses the Entity manager to begin a transaction, and merges the existing Job in the database with the Job object that was passed in as a parameter, then ends the Entity manager transaction.
        Parameters:
        job, - the Job object to be updated.

      • create

        public void create(Job job)
        Allows for the creation of a new Job object in the mongo database. Uses Entity manager to begin a transaction. and persists the Job object that was passed in as a parameter before closing the transaction.
        Parameters:
        job, - the Job object to be created.

      • delete

        public void delete(Job job)
        Allows for the deletion of Job objects in the mongo database. Uses Entity manager to begin a transaction, then removes the Job object that was passed in as a parameter before closing the transaction.
        Parameters:
        job, - the Job object to be deleted.
